runs.comm: starts off with a gentle bail-high short of a length ball outside off. It does not climb as much as Hamilton anticipated, stops a bit on the batsman. Jabbed back towards the bowler off the toe end
similar length but the line is wider, Hamilton stands tall and forces it to the covers
this does not bounce much either, back of a length on off, Hamilton presses forward and works it defensively towards mid-on
floated full and around off, Hamilton shuffles forward and across as he taps towards mid-on again
length ball, holds its line on off, punchily driven to mid-off for one
good length and angled in on off from over the wicket, Sibanda gets a confident stride forward and blocks it in front of his toes
back of a length and in the channel outside off, the carry is more encouraging for Amjad. Left alone
length ball and just a shade outside off, Hamilton stretches forward, he is early into the sweep. Hit on the pad. He is quite fond of this stroke
Hamilton shows intent... he jumps down the track and meets a length ball. Whipped over backward square leg
Hamilton goes low and connects well with the sweep. Good length and on off, Hamilton sweeps it over backward square, sends it into the stands for the first six of this World T20
Amjad shortens his length outside off as Hamilton jumps down the track again. He does not hold anything back. Slapped in the gap at the covers
short on middle and leg, Hamilton sits back in the crease and punches it down to long-on. Smoothly done
Hamilton has found his zone. Back of a length and outside off, skips back and cracks it through the covers

good length and angled in, pushed to mid-off. Hamilton casually runs across for a single. The fielder (Hayat) throws the stumps down. Bullseye. Hamilton is in trouble. Silly error. Hamilton neither slides his bat nor plonks it down. The bat is in the air, as is the front foot. The back foot is outside the crease. Farcical run-out. Hamilton has to go. He has tossed away a bright start
back of a length on off, chopped towards point
back of a length on middle, opens up his shoulders and lifts it nicely, clearing mid-on
full and straight, knocked in front of mid-on for a hurried single
full and shoots low on off, the pitch playing tricks. The batsman stoops low and keeps it out
Sibanda comes down the track, manufactures his own length and drills it back over the bowler's head
dropped short on off, sits up and punished. Pulled in the air, to the right of short midwicket
Haseeb loses his cool after the back-to-back fours. He drags a short ball down leg. Wided
good change-up slower ball, Sibanda can't manufacture his own pace, swiped into the lap of Campbell at midwicket. Free-hit ball. It amounts to nothing
short on middle and leg, he gets into position and pulls over the square leg ump
short leg-stump ball, brushes the thigh and rolls towards square leg
short and width outside off, Champman flings to his right to make a sharp stop. This was forced away
back of a length and outside off, Mutumbami sits back and jabs it to mid-off

Tanwir strikes, Mutumbami holing out to long-on for a duck. He steps away outside leg, Tanwir chases the batsman with a shorter offering. The ball does not quite come on. Dragged to Nadeem Ahmed. He hangs onto the catch in front of his face
full on off, straight-bat push to mid-off
good length and outside off, guided towards point
full on middle, bunted to long-on
another attempted shorter one outside off, hardly rises. Williams has a crack at it, ends up chopping it, the under-edge nutmegging Atkinson, runs through the legs for a fortunate four
drifts in on off, hit to long-on
slides on flat and quick outside off, dragged from there towards deep midwicket with a sweep. Good work in the deep
tossed up on middle, Williams goes low again, this time he brings out the reverse sweep and sends it between point and third man
full on the leg stump, milked to long-on
darted on a back of a length on off, stands tall and punches it down the ground
flighted and just a shade outside off, smartly chipped over the bowler's head. Mopped up in the deep at long-on

Williams plays on now, this does not nutmeg the keeper. Instead, the ball jams into the stumps off the inside edge. Slightly short but not too wide outside off. Williams slashes a cut and drags on. Subdued celebrations from Tanwir
full and keeps low on off, defended back to the bowler
full and straight, tapped to long-on
length ball on off, confidently lofted down the ground, long-on has it covered
length ball on off, presses forward and blocks it to cover
short and just a shade outside off, stops on the batsman. Chopped behind, evades the off stump
loose full toss outside off, driven down the ground
slides on off from round the stumps, lashed to long-off
no hint of flight, fired quick and outside off, long-off in business again
blockhole ball on off, Raza brings his carving knife and slices through point

lobs a full toss, which is driven towards long-on. The pair push for the second. Raza runs towards the danger end. Campbell gathers the throw and breaks the stumps to catch Raza short. He is not even in the frame. HK hitting back after a fast start, second run-out of the innings
Campbell gives this more air on middle and leg, nudged towards square leg
first signs of extra bounce. Shortish and outside off, punched past mid-off
skiddy short ball, rushes onto the batsman - Waller - he aims to full and ends up flapping towards square leg
effort ball. Bouncer on the leg stump, ducks under it
short and angled in, hops and drops it towards cover
short ball on off, picked up and dispatched over midwicket with the wrists
nice and full outside off, eased to long-off
full toss outside off from round the wicket, begs on its knees to be hit. Waller obliges and slaps it past the covers
full and angling across off, Waller plays for the turn, which isn't there, and is beaten
skiddy flat ball on the leg stump, gets an inside edge onto the pad
full and sliding away outside off, plays down the wrong line and is beaten again
floated up around off, knocked to cover
straight roller on off, tapped to long-on
half-volley length outside off, driven hard to long-off
full and aimed at off, poked towards point. Chapman is lurking there
picked away off the pads in front of square on the leg side
yorker, angled in, nailed at the base of off, dug out. Mid-off runs in and fumbles, but the result is only a single
aims another yorker, ends up as a full toss, which is pushed to deep cover
flirts with the wide line outside off. Floats a slower ball outside off. Nothing doing from the batsman
back of a length on off, does not come on. Jabbed towards long-on off the inside half of the bat
full and straight, squirted through point off the outside half now
hurls a yorker outside off, takes the outside edge and wanders to short third man
yorker again, this time at the base of off, jammed back to Campbell
Sibanda shuffles across off, the bowler pushes a leg-side wide
twirled off the pads through square leg, neatly done
fractionally short on off, hit to midwicket on the back foot
sliding across off, waits for the ball to arrive and glides it fine of short third man
full on off and spins away from round the stumps, stabbed to cover
drifts in on middle, shuffles outside leg and lifts it inside out over cover. There is protection in the deep
slower through the air, turn and bounce outside off, the batsman adjusts and helps it towards short third man
drifts in on middle, poked to cover
short and wide outside off, cut firmly to deep cover
Sibanda steps out, the bowler pulls his length back, fires a fizzer and raps the pad
full and straight, driven to long-off
flat and quick on middle, slog-swept in the air.... lands in front of Kinchit at deep midwicket
punched on the back foot to midwicket
deflected off the pads through square leg as this was shorter in length
angled across off, dabbed to cover for a quick single
darted full on off, sliced through point. End of a tidy spell from Campbell
tossed up, turn and dip outside off. Slog sweep and a miss
better, safer option to go down the ground. Sibanda dances out and drills it flat over long-on to bring up his maiden T20I fifty
Sibanda steps out, this is pushed quicker and flatter, hits the pad
Sibanda makes room and slaps this short ball from outside off to long-off
slid through outside off, chopped past point
faster one, drifts into the legs, clipped to long-on
shortish on the leg stump, makes room and punches through cover. Rath has overstepped
faster one, shorter, pulled only to long-on
length ball on off, sliced over cover. Sibanda calls for the second and gets it
lobbed up and drifts in, dabbed defensively to cover
Waller makes a hint of room outside leg, the bowler follows him and keeps him quiet. Played back to the bowler
Waller flits outside leg again, this short ball is cut to deep cover
shot! Flighted on middle, Sibanda runs down the track and meets the pitch, and lofts it over long-on with tremendous authority. Looks like Sibanda is poised to crank up the tempo
Aizaz slips in a slower short ball outside off. Waller chases it and cuts it in the air. He hit it well but straight into the lap of Shah at sweeper cover, chest-high clasp
pretty full on off, thrashed down the ground
back of a length on off, chopped towards point. Chigumbura slips but completes the single
target practice again. Shabby full toss, this should have been smashed over midwicket. Instead, Sibanda mis-hits it to Chapman. Simple catch
full and outside off, sliced past backward point to third man
off-stump yorker, jammed back to the bowler. End of a top, top over
pushed through outside off, bunted to long-off

pinned plumb in front! Full straight ball, Tiripano goes for a two-ball duck. He misses the reverse-sweep. Hit on the back thigh in front of middle. The finger went up instantly. It would have crashed into middle and leg. Zim lose three wickets in eight balls
Nadeem held this one back outside off and beats Wellington
quick short ball, mistimed pull to midwicket
darted outside off, slashed through the covers
looped up on middle, dab-and-run single to cover
pretty full on off, driven to long-on
full and straight, weak little flick to midwicket
full toss outside off, sliced to deep cover
fractionally short and outside off, Chigu unleashes a clean swing and slams the slower ball over long-on
and again! This is fuller and outside off, muscled over long-off now
Aizaz goes for a yorker outside off, ends up pushing an outside-off full toss, sliced to short third man
back of a length on off, belted flat to long-on. Chigu wants two. He wants the strike. The fielder rifles an accurate throw to catch Wellington well short;the bowler tips the bails off
full and just a shade outside off, drilled to long-off. Kept to one
Haseeb slides a leg-side wide
short and outside off, possibly a slower ball, beats the attempted cut. Atkinson under-arm flicks the ball onto the stumps. The pair hare across for a bye
dug in short on middle, pulled firmly over midwicket. Zim reach 150
dug in short and outside off, Chigumbura lays into it and slugs it high and over long-on
shortish again, this one tucks Chigu up for room. Deflected behind square for a couple
